abstract: United States proposes creating United Nations sanctions committee to address South Sudan crisis in reaction to inability of Pres Salva Kiir and rebel leader Riek Machar to stick to a peace agreement; numerous ceasefires have failed and tens of thousands have died in the civil war.
lead_paragraph: The United States is proposing the creation of a United Nations sanctions committee for the South Sudan crisis and says an arms embargo is possible if the warring sides cannot stick to a peace deal.

headline.main: Sanctions Panel Is Urged for South Sudan
headline.print_headline: Sanctions Panel Is Urged for South Sudan

snippet: The United States is proposing the creation of a United Nations sanctions committee for the South Sudan crisis and says an arms embargo is possible if the warring sides cannot stick to a peace deal.
